page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW OF THE AREA.
page.content: Our area is a rural area on the edge of the city of Lichfield, and the village of Whittington. A large new housing development is spreading out from Lichfield into the surrounding countryside, but other than this, our area contains very few houses or amenities. The most outstanding features are a large golf course, a Youth Custody Centre at Swinfen Hall, Whittington Barracks and King Edward VI Comprehensive School. The area also contains the tiny village of Botany Bay, a number of small farms and one major road, the A 38 that goes from Derby into Birminham.
